intro: Xanthophyllum virens, commonly known as the green flame plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its vibrant green leaves and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Xanthophyllum virens has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
